largest island by area. It is located off the Pomeranian coast in the
Baltic Sea and belongs to the state of Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania.

The "gateway" to RÃ¼gen island is the Hanseatic city of Stralsund, where it
is linked to the mainland by road and railway via the RÃ¼gen Bridge and
Causeway, two routes crossing the two-kilometre-wide Strelasund, a sound of
the Baltic Sea.

RÃ¼gen has a maximum length of 51.4 km (from north to south), a maximum
width of 42.8 km in the south and an area of 926 kmÂ². The coast is
characterized by numerous sandy beaches, bays (both lagoons known as [[bodden]]
and open bays known as Wieke), as well as projecting peninsulas and headlands.
In June 2011, UNESCO awarded the status of a World Heritage Site to the Jasmund
National Park, famous for its vast stands of beeches and chalk cliffs like
King's Chair, the main landmark of RÃ¼gen island. See inter alia the report
by the [http://www.tagesschau.de/inland/unescobuchen100.html ARD-Tagesschau]
dated 25 June 2011

The island of RÃ¼gen is part of the district of Vorpommern-RÃ¼gen, with its county
seat in Stralsund. The towns on RÃ¼gen are: Bergen, Sassnitz, Putbus and Garz. In
addition, there are the Baltic seaside resorts of Binz, Baabe, GÃ¶hren, Sellin
and Thiessow.

RÃ¼gen is very popular as a tourist destination because of its resort
architecture, the diverse landscape and its long, sandy beaches.
